headline: BYD breaks ground on Cambodia EV plant as part of global expansion - The Business Times
context: CHINESE carmaker BYD has broken ground on a US$32 million passenger electric vehicle (EV) plant in Cambodia, marking its latest move to localise production as part of a broader global expansion that has seen it become a top-selling EV brand in markets from Brazil to the UK.

The company said on Tuesday (Apr 29) that the plant in the Sihanoukville Special Economic Zone is expected to be finished by October 2025, with production starting sometime in the fourth quarter. The facility, with an annual capacity of 10,000 units, will make both battery EVs and plug-in hybrid EVs.
